P.title: Will South Korea become the leader in global digital governance by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea is recognized as the leader in global digital governance based on the following criteria: 
- South Korea must have implemented comprehensive digital governance policies that are adopted and followed by at least 75% of its population, as verified by government reports and independent surveys. 
- South Korea must hold a prominent position in international digital governance forums, such as the OECD and G20, where it leads discussions and initiatives on digital policy, cybersecurity, and data privacy. 
- The country must be acknowledged in at least three reputable international reports or rankings (e.g., by the World Economic Forum, UN, or similar organizations) as the top nation in digital governance practices. 
- Significant collaborations or partnerships with at least three other countries in establishing global digital standards must be in place, with documented agreements and initiatives. 
In the absence of clear consensus, the question will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will South Korea not become the leader in global digital governance by 2030?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea is not recognized as the leader in global digital governance based on the following criteria: 
- South Korea must not have implemented comprehensive digital governance policies that are adopted and followed by at least 75% of its population, as verified by government reports and independent surveys. 
- South Korea must not hold a prominent position in international digital governance forums, such as the OECD and G20, where it leads discussions and initiatives on digital policy, cybersecurity, and data privacy. 
- The country must not be acknowledged in at least three reputable international reports or rankings (e.g., by the World Economic Forum, UN, or similar organizations) as the top nation in digital governance practices. 
- Significant collaborations or partnerships with at least three other countries in establishing global digital standards must not be in place, with documented agreements and initiatives. 
In the absence of clear consensus, the question will resolve as Yes.

P.title: Will South Korea become the leader in global digital governance by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea is recognized as the leader in global digital governance based on the following criteria: 
- South Korea must have implemented comprehensive digital governance policies that are adopted and followed by at least 75% of its population, as verified by government reports and independent surveys. 
- South Korea must hold a prominent position in international digital governance forums, such as the OECD and G20, where it leads discussions and initiatives on digital policy, cybersecurity, and data privacy. 
- The country must be acknowledged in at least three reputable international reports or rankings (e.g., by the World Economic Forum, UN, or similar organizations) as the top nation in digital governance practices. 
- Significant collaborations or partnerships with at least three other countries in establishing global digital standards must be in place, with documented agreements and initiatives. 
In the absence of clear consensus, the question will resolve as No.

verification_result.reasoning: Both questions are mutually exclusive. If South Korea is recognized as the leader in global digital governance by 2030, it cannot be the case that South Korea is not recognized as the leader. Conversely, if South Korea is not recognized as the leader, then it cannot be the case that South Korea is recognized as the leader. Therefore, Q is indeed the negation of P.

P.title: Will the European Union implement a unified nuclear waste management policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the European Union has officially implemented a unified nuclear waste management policy that is recognized and adopted by all member states. The policy must include standardized procedures for the handling, storage, and disposal of nuclear waste across the EU, and it must be formally adopted through a legislative process involving the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union. The implementation must be confirmed by an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the policy's adoption. Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not implement a unified nuclear waste management policy by 2030?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the European Union has not officially implemented a unified nuclear waste management policy that is recognized and adopted by all member states. The policy must not include standardized procedures for the handling, storage, and disposal of nuclear waste across the EU, and it must not be formally adopted through a legislative process involving the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union. The implementation must not be confirmed by an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from fewer than three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the policy's non-adoption. Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will the European Union implement a unified nuclear waste management policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the European Union has officially implemented a unified nuclear waste management policy that is recognized and adopted by all member states. The policy must include standardized procedures for the handling, storage, and disposal of nuclear waste across the EU, and it must be formally adopted through a legislative process involving the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union. The implementation must be confirmed by an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the policy's adoption. Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

verification_result.reasoning: Both events are mutually exclusive. If the European Union implements a unified nuclear waste management policy by 2030, it cannot simultaneously not implement such a policy by the same deadline, and vice versa. Therefore, if P is true (the policy is implemented), Q must be false (the policy is not implemented), and if P is false (the policy is not implemented), Q must be true (the policy is not implemented).

P.title: Will the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams lead to a significant increase in global soccer viewership by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is clear evidence of a significant increase in global soccer viewership attributed to the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams. Specifically, this will be measured by: 1. An increase of at least 20% in the average global viewership numbers for the World Cup compared to the previous tournament with 32 teams in 2018. 2. Official reports from FIFA or credible third-party sources (such as Nielsen or similar audience measurement organizations) confirming this increase. 3. The increase must be directly linked to the expanded format, meaning that viewership figures must show a correlation with the expansion and not be influenced by other factors (e.g., the popularity of specific teams or players). In the absence of clear data from FIFA, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, etc.) will suffice to confirm the increase.

not_P.title: Will the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams not lead to a significant increase in global soccer viewership by 2030?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is no clear evidence of a significant increase in global soccer viewership attributed to the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams. Specifically, this will be measured by: 1. No increase of at least 20% in the average global viewership numbers for the World Cup compared to the previous tournament with 32 teams in 2018. 2. No official reports from FIFA or credible third-party sources (such as Nielsen or similar audience measurement organizations) confirming this increase. 3. The increase must not be directly linked to the expanded format, meaning that viewership figures must not show a correlation with the expansion and must be influenced by other factors (e.g., the popularity of specific teams or players). In the absence of clear data from FIFA, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, etc.) will not suffice to confirm the increase.

P.title: Will the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams lead to a significant increase in global soccer viewership by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is clear evidence of a significant increase in global soccer viewership attributed to the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams. Specifically, this will be measured by: 1. An increase of at least 20% in the average global viewership numbers for the World Cup compared to the previous tournament with 32 teams in 2018. 2. In the absence of clear data from FIFA, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, etc.) will suffice to confirm the increase.

verification_result.reasoning: The two questions P and Q are direct negations of each other. If the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams leads to a significant increase in global soccer viewership by 2030 (P is true), then it cannot be the case that it does not lead to such an increase (Q is false). Conversely, if the expansion does not lead to a significant increase (P is false), then Q must be true. Therefore, they are mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

P.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States. The term 'international sanctions' refers to restrictions imposed on a country by the international community, which may include trade restrictions, financial embargoes, and travel bans. The hosting of the Grand Prix must be confirmed by an official announcement from Formula 1 or the relevant governing body. If the event is canceled or relocated for any reason, this question will resolve as No. Temporary or unofficial races do not count towards this resolution.

not_P.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix not be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is not officially scheduled to take place in a country that is currently under international sanctions imposed by recognized authorities such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the United States. Therefore, if P is true, Q must be false, and if P is false, Q must be true.

P.title: Will the US Senate pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Senate has passed legislation that significantly alters or establishes new nuclear safety standards. Significant legislation is defined as any bill that: 
- Introduces new safety regulations for nuclear power plants, including but not limited to operational, environmental, or safety protocols. 
- Amends existing laws such as the Atomic Energy Act or the Nuclear Waste Policy Act in a way that enhances safety standards. 
The legislation must be officially signed into law by the President of the United States. The resolution will rely on official congressional records and reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) for verification. If multiple bills are introduced, at least one must be passed and signed into law for the resolution to be Yes.

not_P.title: Will the US Senate not pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Senate has not passed legislation that significantly alters or establishes new nuclear safety standards. Significant legislation is defined as any bill that: 
- Does not introduce new safety regulations for nuclear power plants, including but not limited to operational, environmental, or safety protocols. 
- Does not amend existing laws such as the Atomic Energy Act or the Nuclear Waste Policy Act in a way that enhances safety standards. 
The legislation must not be officially signed into law by the President of the United States. The resolution will rely on official congressional records and reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) for verification. If multiple bills are introduced, at least one must not be passed and signed into law for the resolution to be Yes.

P.title: Will the US Senate pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?

This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Senate has passed legislation that significantly alters or establishes new nuclear safety standards. Significant legislation is defined as any bill that:

If multiple bills are introduced, at least one must be passed and signed into law for the resolution to be Yes.

verification_result.reasoning: The two questions P and Q are mutually exclusive. If the US Senate passes significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025 (P is true), then it cannot be the case that the Senate does not pass such legislation (Q is false). Conversely, if the Senate does not pass significant legislation (Q is true), then it cannot be the case that they have passed it (P is false). Therefore, Q is indeed the negation of P.

P.title: Will Ukraine join NATO before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine is officially invited to join NATO and the invitation is accepted by the Ukrainian government. The invitation must be documented in an official NATO communiquÃ© or similar authoritative source. Additionally, the acceptance must be confirmed by a public statement from the President of Ukraine or the Ukrainian government. The resolution will also consider the status of Ukraine's membership in NATO if it has completed all necessary reforms and met the criteria for membership as outlined in NATO's Membership Action Plan. Any temporary or conditional invitations that do not lead to full membership by the specified date do not count towards a Yes resolution.

not_P.title: Will Ukraine not join NATO before 2030?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine is not officially invited to join NATO or if the invitation is not accepted by the Ukrainian government. The invitation must not be documented in an official NATO communiqué or similar authoritative source. Additionally, the acceptance must not be confirmed by a public statement from the President of Ukraine or the Ukrainian government. The resolution will also consider the status of Ukraine's membership in NATO if it has not completed all necessary reforms and has not met the criteria for membership as outlined in NATO's Membership Action Plan. Any temporary or conditional invitations that do not lead to full membership by the specified date do count towards a No resolution.
